description: The vast desert region of Arabasta where Crocodile battles Luffy and leaves him for dead in quicksand. This is also where Nico Robin saves Luffy and asks him about the Will of D.

keyEvents.title: Crocodile Defeats Luffy
keyEvents.description: Crocodile stabs Luffy and throws him into quicksand using Desert Girasole, leaving him to die in the vast desert.
keyEvents.significance: The location of Luffy's second defeat by Crocodile, marking a critical low point in the Arabasta arc.

keyEvents.title: Robin Asks About the Will of D
keyEvents.description: Nico Robin saves Luffy from the quicksand in the desert and asks him about the mysterious Will of D.
keyEvents.significance: The desert becomes the setting for one of the most important lore moments in the early series.

description: A river in Arabasta that the Straw Hat Pirates must cross to reach Alubarna. The land crab Hasami cannot traverse the water, leading to complications until the Kung-Fu Dugongs help them cross using a knocked-out Sandora Catfish.

keyEvents.title: Sea Monster Attacks at Sandora River
keyEvents.description: A sea monster emerges from the Sandora River and attacks the Straw Hats when they attempt to cross.
keyEvents.significance: Creates a challenge for the crew and sets up the arrival of the Kung-Fu Dugongs.

keyEvents.title: Kung-Fu Dugongs Save the Crew
keyEvents.description: The Kung-Fu Dugongs defeat the sea monster and help the Straw Hats cross the Sandora River.
keyEvents.significance: Shows Luffy's lasting impact and ability to create loyal allies.

description: The capital city of Arabasta where both the rebel forces and the royal army are converging. The Straw Hats are racing to reach Alubarna to stop the civil war.

keyEvents.title: King Cobra Held Captive in Alubarna
keyEvents.description: King Cobra is revealed to be kidnapped and held by Mr. 4 and Miss Merry Christmas in Alubarna.
keyEvents.significance: Reveals part of Crocodile's conspiracy and sets up future confrontations.
